verses.kjv: Then came together unto him the Pharisees, and certain of the scribes, which came from Jerusalem.
verses.web: Then the Pharisees and some of the scribes gathered together to him, having come from Jerusalem.
verses.ct: A group of Pharisees and some scribes who had traveled from Jerusalem gathered around Jesus.

verses.kjv: And when they saw some of his disciples eat bread with defiled, that is to say, with unwashen, hands, they found fault.
verses.web: Now when they saw some of his disciples eating bread with defiled, that is unwashed, hands, they found fault.
verses.ct: They noticed that some of his disciples were eating without washing their hands first, which they considered unclean.

verses.kjv: For the Pharisees, and all the Jews, except they wash their hands oft, eat not, holding the tradition of the elders.
verses.web: (For the Pharisees and all the Jews don’t eat unless they wash their hands and forearms, holding to the tradition of the elders.
verses.ct: (The Pharisees and all Jewish people, following the tradition passed down from their ancestors, won't eat without first carefully washing their hands and forearms.

verses.kjv: And when they come from the market, except they wash, they eat not. And many other things there be, which they have received to hold, as the washing of cups, and pots, brasen vessels, and of tables.
verses.web: They don’t eat when they come from the marketplace unless they bathe themselves, and there are many other things, which they have received to hold to: washings of cups, pitchers, bronze vessels, and couches.)
verses.ct: When they come back from the marketplace, they won't eat until they've washed themselves. They also follow many other inherited rules, like ceremonial washing of cups, pitchers, bronze vessels, and dining couches.)

verses.kjv: Then the Pharisees and scribes asked him, Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashen hands?
verses.web: The Pharisees and the scribes asked him, “Why don’t your disciples walk according to the tradition of the elders, but eat their bread with unwashed hands?”
verses.ct: So the Pharisees and scribes confronted Jesus: "Why don't your disciples follow the tradition of the elders? They eat their food with unwashed hands!"

verses.kjv: He answered and said unto them, Well hath Esaias prophesied of you hypocrites, as it is written, This people honoureth me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.
verses.web: He answered them, “Well did Isaiah prophesy of you hypocrites, as it is written, ‘This people honors me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "Isaiah was right when he prophesied about you hypocrites. As it's written: 'These people honor me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.

verses.kjv: Howbeit in vain do they worship me, teaching for doctrines the commandments of men.
verses.web: But they worship me in vain, teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.’
verses.ct: Their worship is pointless, because they teach human rules as if they were God's commands.'

verses.kjv: For laying aside the commandment of God, ye hold the tradition of men, as the washing of pots and cups: and many other such like things ye do.
verses.web: “For you set aside the commandment of God, and hold tightly to the tradition of men—the washing of pitchers and cups, and you do many other such things.”
verses.ct: You've tossed aside God's commandment and clung to human tradition — things like washing pitchers and cups — and you do plenty of other things just like it."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Full well ye reject the commandment of God, that ye may keep your own tradition.
verses.web: He said to them, “Full well do you reject the commandment of God, that you may keep your tradition.
verses.ct: Then he told them, "You have a fine way of setting aside God's commandment so you can protect your own tradition!

verses.kjv: For Moses said, Honour thy father and thy mother; and, Whoso curseth father or mother, let him die the death:
verses.web: For Moses said, ‘Honor your father and your mother;’ and, ‘He who speaks evil of father or mother, let him be put to death.’
verses.ct: Moses said, 'Honor your father and your mother,' and, 'Anyone who curses their father or mother must be put to death.'

verses.kjv: But ye say, If a man shall say to his father or mother, It is Corban, that is to say, a gift, by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me; he shall be free.
verses.web: But you say, ‘If a man tells his father or his mother, “Whatever profit you might have received from me is Corban,” ’ ” that is to say, given to God,
verses.ct: But you say that if someone tells their father or mother, 'Whatever I might have used to help you is Corban' — meaning it's been dedicated to God —

verses.kjv: And ye suffer him no more to do ought for his father or his mother;
verses.web: “then you no longer allow him to do anything for his father or his mother,
verses.ct: then you no longer let that person do anything for their father or mother.

verses.kjv: Making the word of God of none effect through your tradition, which ye have delivered: and many such like things do ye.
verses.web: making void the word of God by your tradition, which you have handed down. You do many things like this.”
verses.ct: You cancel out the word of God with the traditions you've handed down. And you do many other things just like this."

verses.kjv: And when he had called all the people unto him, he said unto them, Hearken unto me every one of you, and understand:
verses.web: He called all the multitude to himself, and said to them, “Hear me, all of you, and understand.
verses.ct: Jesus called the whole crowd over and said, "Listen to me, all of you, and make sure you understand this:

verses.kjv: There is nothing from without a man, that entering into him can defile him: but the things which come out of him, those are they that defile the man.
verses.web: There is nothing from outside of the man, that going into him can defile him; but the things which proceed out of the man are those that defile the man.
verses.ct: Nothing that enters a person from the outside can make them unclean. It's what comes out of a person that makes them unclean."

verses.kjv: If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.
verses.web: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear!”
verses.ct: "If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear!"

verses.kjv: And when he was entered into the house from the people, his disciples asked him concerning the parable.
verses.web: When he had entered into a house away from the multitude, his disciples asked him about the parable.
verses.ct: After he left the crowd and went inside a house, his disciples asked him what the parable meant.

verses.kjv: And he saith unto them, Are ye so without understanding also? Do ye not perceive, that whatsoever thing from without entereth into the man, it cannot defile him;
verses.web: He said to them, “Are you also without understanding? Don’t you perceive that whatever goes into the man from outside can’t defile him,
verses.ct: He said to them, "Do you still not get it? Don't you realize that nothing going into a person from the outside can make them unclean?

verses.kjv: Because it entereth not into his heart, but into the belly, and goeth out into the draught, purging all meats?
verses.web: because it doesn’t go into his heart, but into his stomach, then into the latrine, making all foods clean?”
verses.ct: It doesn't go into the heart — it goes into the stomach and then passes out of the body." (By saying this, he declared all foods clean.)

verses.kjv: And he said, That which cometh out of the man, that defileth the man.
verses.web: He said, “That which proceeds out of the man, that defiles the man.
verses.ct: He continued, "It's what comes out of a person that makes them unclean.

verses.kjv: For from within, out of the heart of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, fornications, murders,
verses.web: For from within, out of the hearts of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, sexual sins, murders, thefts,
verses.ct: From the inside, out of a person's heart, come evil thoughts, adultery, sexual sin, murder,

verses.kjv: Thefts, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, lasciviousness, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, foolishness:
verses.web: covetings, wickedness, deceit, lustful desires, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, and foolishness.
verses.ct: theft, greed, wickedness, deceit, lustful desires, envy, blasphemy, pride, and foolishness.

verses.kjv: All these evil things come from within, and defile the man.
verses.web: All these evil things come from within, and defile the man.”
verses.ct: All these evil things come from within, and they are what make a person unclean."

verses.kjv: And from thence he arose, and went into the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and entered into an house, and would have no man know it: but he could not be hid.
verses.web: From there he arose, and went away into the borders of Tyre and Sidon. He entered into a house, and didn’t want anyone to know it, but he couldn’t escape notice.
verses.ct: Jesus left that area and traveled to the region of Tyre and Sidon. He went into a house and didn't want anyone to know he was there, but he couldn't stay hidden.

verses.kjv: For a certain woman, whose young daughter had an unclean spirit, heard of him, and came and fell at his feet:
verses.web: For a woman, whose little daughter had an unclean spirit, having heard of him, came and fell down at his feet.
verses.ct: A woman whose young daughter was possessed by an unclean spirit heard about him and came and fell at his feet.

verses.kjv: The woman was a Greek, a Syrophenician by nation; and she besought him that he would cast forth the devil out of her daughter.
verses.web: Now the woman was a Greek, a Syrophoenician by race. She begged him that he would cast the demon out of her daughter.
verses.ct: She was a Greek woman, Syrophoenician by birth. She begged Jesus to drive the demon out of her daughter.

verses.kjv: But Jesus said unto her, Let the children first be filled: for it is not meet to take the children’s bread, and to cast it unto the dogs.
verses.web: But Jesus said to her, “Let the children be filled first, for it is not appropriate to take the children’s bread and throw it to the dogs.”
verses.ct: But Jesus told her, "Let the children eat first. It isn't right to take the children's bread and throw it to the dogs."

verses.kjv: And she answered and said unto him, Yes, Lord: yet the dogs under the table eat of the children’s crumbs.
verses.web: But she answered him, “Yes, Lord. Yet even the dogs under the table eat the children’s crumbs.”
verses.ct: She replied, "Yes, Lord, but even the dogs under the table eat the children's crumbs."

verses.kjv: And he said unto her, For this saying go thy way; the devil is gone out of thy daughter.
verses.web: He said to her, “For this saying, go your way. The demon has gone out of your daughter.”
verses.ct: Jesus said to her, "Because of that answer, go home — the demon has left your daughter."

verses.kjv: And when she was come to her house, she found the devil gone out, and her daughter laid upon the bed.
verses.web: She went away to her house, and found the child having been laid on the bed, with the demon gone out.
verses.ct: She went home and found her daughter lying peacefully on the bed, and the demon was gone.

verses.kjv: And again, departing from the coasts of Tyre and Sidon, he came unto the sea of Galilee, through the midst of the coasts of Decapolis.
verses.web: Again he departed from the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and came to the sea of Galilee, through the middle of the region of Decapolis.
verses.ct: Jesus left the region of Tyre and Sidon and made his way to the Sea of Galilee, traveling through the middle of the Decapolis region.

verses.kjv: And they bring unto him one that was deaf, and had an impediment in his speech; and they beseech him to put his hand upon him.
verses.web: They brought to him one who was deaf and had an impediment in his speech. They begged him to lay his hand on him.
verses.ct: Some people brought him a man who was deaf and could barely speak, and they begged Jesus to place his hand on him.

verses.kjv: And he took him aside from the multitude, and put his fingers into his ears, and he spit, and touched his tongue;
verses.web: He took him aside from the multitude, privately, and put his fingers into his ears, and he spat, and touched his tongue.
verses.ct: Jesus took the man away from the crowd to be alone with him. He put his fingers in the man's ears, then spit and touched the man's tongue.

verses.kjv: And looking up to heaven, he sighed, and saith unto him, Ephphatha, that is, Be opened.
verses.web: Looking up to heaven, he sighed, and said to him, “Ephphatha!” that is, “Be opened!”
verses.ct: Looking up to heaven, he let out a deep sigh and said to the man, "Ephphatha!" — which means, "Be opened!"

verses.kjv: And straightway his ears were opened, and the string of his tongue was loosed, and he spake plain.
verses.web: Immediately his ears were opened, and the impediment of his tongue was released, and he spoke clearly.
verses.ct: Instantly the man's ears opened, his tongue was freed, and he began speaking clearly.

verses.kjv: And he charged them that they should tell no man: but the more he charged them, so much the more a great deal they published it;
verses.web: He commanded them that they should tell no one, but the more he commanded them, so much the more widely they proclaimed it.
verses.ct: Jesus ordered them not to tell anyone, but the more he insisted, the more they spread the news.

verses.kjv: And were beyond measure astonished, saying, He hath done all things well: he maketh both the deaf to hear, and the dumb to speak.
verses.web: They were astonished beyond measure, saying, “He has done all things well. He makes even the deaf hear, and the mute speak!”
verses.ct: People were completely amazed, saying, "Everything he does is incredible! He even makes the deaf hear and the mute speak!"
